ranked_diseases.explanation: Angelman Syndrome is characterized by intellectual disability and delayed speech and language development, which are prominent features in this patient.
Rett Syndrome often presents with intellectual disability and delayed speech and language development, especially in early stages.
Fragile X Syndrome is a common cause of inherited intellectual disability and is often associated with speech and language delays.
Down Syndrome frequently includes intellectual disability and delayed speech and language development as part of its phenotypic spectrum.
Williams Syndrome can present with intellectual disability and speech delays, though often with a unique profile of strengths and weaknesses.
Prader-Willi Syndrome includes intellectual disability and speech delays among its features, though other symptoms are usually more prominent.
Phelan-McDermid Syndrome is associated with intellectual disability and significant speech and language delays.
Smith-Magenis Syndrome includes intellectual disability and speech delays, along with behavioral characteristics.
Cri-du-Chat Syndrome is marked by intellectual disability and delayed speech development, often with a distinctive cry in infancy.
Cohen Syndrome can present with intellectual disability and speech delays, though it is also associated with other distinctive features.
